issues.title: Repository migration helper
issues.body: The guide describes how to create new repo, but no mention of pushing existing ones. While there's probably a way to do that manually (?), it would be great to automate that (ideally, initial clone from git address, but even simply creating empty repo that can be pushed to would be fine).

issue_comments.body:
>You can git push --force.

Yeah, i also thought about that. It's just that publishing didn't work after that and i thought that maybe it was a problem with force. But apparently i can't publish even non-forced push (due to lack of peers perhaps?), so if it's generally known to work it should be fine (as long as i can get publishing working).

>that is not possible

Thanks for the explanation.

>Are there any repositories I can seed?

Hmm, i've been only trying with test one so far. Let me push something more useful, but still not too big.. ok, [here](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/?182Zh6CGp1yQhttmnRbgFktzsABAL3MrHn) it is. Haven't published to index yet, since i'm a bit afraid of the warning (that description couldn't be changed).

>You did press Sign & Publish changes, right?

Yeah, and it says "content publish failed". But now that i look at 0hello, it says there are 2 peers for my repo (unlike my first test repo, which has only me).
Oh well, i guess i should just start with regular zite publishing before trying out gitcenter. Thanks for help anyway.
